column2: pron. ) was one of the chiefs of the Maiar
column3: and the handmaiden to Queen Varda.

column1: She is only mentioned briefly in the Valaquenta
column2: where Ilmarë is described along with the Maia Eönwë who was the banner-bearer and herald of King Manwë.

column1: In the early stages of the legendarium
column2: Ilmarë (then called Erinti) was the daughter of Manwë and Varda
column3: but the concept of the Valar having Valarindi was abandoned and Ilmarë became Vardas handmaiden.

column1: Her name may be related to one of the Quenya words for "Starlight".
column2: entry GIL Christopher Tolkien has noted that Ilmarë is related to such words as Ilmen and Ilmarin.

column1: Category:Characters in The Book of Lost Tales
